intro: Hieracium subhapalotrichum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium subhapalotrichum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
